name: Rosemary-Orange Oven-Dried Tomatoes
keywords: fall, orange oil, rosemary oil, tomato, side dish, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 28 medium-size plum tomatoes, the core end cut off, halved lengthwise

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Combine the rosemary and orange oils in a small bowl. Using a pastry brush, coat both sides of the tomato halves lightly with the oil mixture. Place skin side down on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste.

Bake the tomatoes until they have shrunk to about one-quarter of their original size, about 4 to 6 hours; they should remain soft and juicy. Allow them to cool on the baking sheet. Place in a container and store in the refrigerator.
